description:
Animals need brave rescuers now. Defy a thousand dangers, help free the protected animals, take them back to the savannah and the primeval forest! You will have to deal with evil hunters along the way. You have to cross the Nile, which is teeming with wild hippos. You are flying over the barren Sahara. You can only count on the help of caravans. Who will be the first to bring back and feed all five animals?

Game rules: The object of the game is to return the animals to their habitats, the winner is the first to return five animals. They rescue an animal at the camp site by taking an animal card with them. They roll the dice, choosing their own route to get the water and food that will be right for the animal on the way, and then take it back to its natural habitat. When entering a caravan field, we get help cards, when entering a poaching field, we have to draw obstruction cards - unless we have handcuffs, in which case we can take the poach to the hunter.

Ancient Blood - The Order of Vampire Hunters is a cooperative story-driven game that can be played as solo mode, as standalone games, or as a campaign. Choose a story and begin your journey. Be brave and wise, as every choice you make along your path will impact the game world. The wrong choice could awaken your most hidden fears. Fight side by side with your fellow hunters like never before using combo attacks, get help from locals using your skills, and find all the clues that will lead you to the master of each Vampires' clan, The Elder Lord.

Ancient Blood is a prequel to The Order of Vampire Hunters. It features some game mechanics inspired by the old game, but it is a new game. It is not compatible with the previous one, since Ancient Blood is a story-driven game in which your decisions will influence how the game develops and the end of the story. The new game features exploration, crafting, resource management, and leveling up. This time your decisions will change the story of the game, so be prepared to deal with the consequences of your choices.

Can you defeat the Elder Lords?

Jonathan Eaton, billionaire and owner of Vestigium Industries, combines ruling the biggest corporation on earth with adventuring in temples and labyrinths. He leaves everyone perplexed when he announces his retirement. And even more so when he explains how he will chose his successor: like a modern day Willy Wonka he challenges you and your friends to participate in the contest of the century. The winner gets all the Vestigium stocks and will be the richest person on earth. Are you in?

This is the second part of the series.

Elf King Red is a fastplay game using the Lucid Eye Engine, set in the Elf realms of the Isles of Eas, previously seen in The Red Book of The Elf King & Troll Wars. Ownership of those two books is not essential as this is a standalone product, but they contain lots of colourful background and setting information which some players may find useful. Elf King Red uses similar sized armies to Savage Core, which is around 7 figures or so, seven being a mystical number for the Elves. The game has been written to provide a playable experience with a low commitment entry point.

This free rulebook provides all the basic rules needed to play and includes stats for all of the Factions, otherwise known as Circles in Elf King Red.

So once again strap on your Faeblade of Starmetal, don your Glamourbound Armour and prepare your magick, for Red War and The Fall of All.

Obscure War is a tabletop miniature board game in which Warwulf Cabal and Vampyric Cabal fight for the control of Obscure Plane Domains. The game takes place in a contemporary Dark Fantasy universe with a rather spectacular mechanic of Power Cards that interact directly on the Game zone and affect the Characters in game.

You have 3 phases in a Turn : Activation, Power, and Dissolution.

During his/her activation, a Character (miniature) can perform 4 types of Optional actions : Power card Action, movement action, attack action, and control action. Each Cabal activates its Characters one after the other until the activation of all the 8 Characters deployed on the Game zone.

In the Power phase, each Cabal gains 1 Power Point for each Obscure Plane’s Domain it controls.

In the Dissipation phase, all the Power Cards are discarded and placed in the Discard.

To win Obscure War, a Cabal must have the highest Power point score after 3 Turns.

ã‚¦ãƒãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚«ã‚¤ã‚® (Uchu Kaigi) is a trick-taking game from Japan, about an "interspace conference on Earth".

The players are trying to be selected as the ambassador for an alien conference on Earth. By providing entertainment for the delegates from seven different worlds, a player tries to curry favour. But if they give too much to one of the aliens, they will be penalised for favouritism. They will lose points, and their rivals may gain.

The game follows normal trick-taking rules, players following the colour lead. The cards shows an alien and the amount of hospitality the player is offering. Winning the trick gets the player the host spot and the cards go to their tableau.

Rounds end when a player exhausts their hand. The game end when somebody reaches enough points or enough rounds are played. The player with the most points wins.

However, the different alien races trigger effects, either when the card is played or scored. For example, a player might be forced out of a round, or lose points for having too many cards of one alien. This means players have to make more choices than simply playing high cards.
user summary

Stack the Scoops is a an award winning ice-cream themed family card game kids and adults can enjoy together! Created to be both fun and educational, Stack the Scoops helps reinforce fundamental math skills while encouraging families to connect through games.

The premise is simple, kids and adults take turns trying to make ice cream sets by collecting a base, scoop, and topping. Different cards are worth different points. At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

Kids love the easy playability and the fun images while the strategy plays on classic card game concepts making it recognizable and fun for adults.

Relive the First Balkan War in this exciting and quick playing game. Having recently lost Libyan and Adriatic territories to the Italians, the Ottoman Empire has shown its weakness. Serbia, Greece, and Bulgaria now see this as their opportunity to expand and claim the Balkans for themselves. Will you maintain the Empire and hold lands held since the 14th century for the Sultan? Or will you take your rightful lands from the sick man of Europe and secure your place on the Balkan peninsula?

Designed to play quickly and easily, The First Balkan War will allow you to easily teach younger audiences, and anyone knew to board gaming, how to play A&A style games. Move and recruit armies, rolls dice, and conquer the map. For those veterans of A&A, you already own all the pieces you need to play! Just buy the rondel packs and any relevant units you want for a more immersive experience. Test your strategies against each other and determine the fate of the future powder-keg of Europe!

ãƒ¬ãƒ ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ (Lemures) is a horror game from Japan. The game can be played solitaire or as a two player co-operative game. The player is exploring a strange fantastic castle, helping souls trapped, and seeking their own way out.

The publisher says:
Is there a place for the soul to return here? The abyss is changing. You will always be exposed to the threat of unknown beings in the castle. Explore the interior of the old castle while rejecting "they".

Since the inside of the castle changes with each play, different developments will come every time. Co-operative play with two people is also possible.

During your exploration, you may find the souls of those who once lived in the castle. Such a soul is already a light in front of the wind, but if you give it power, it will bloom beautiful flowers. On the contrary, if you take power, it will soon die.

You cannot survive in the castle without strong power. Let's create a new technique from Reason and Instinct. There is some danger in learning the art of Instinct. The ending changes depending on whether you follow Reason or Instinct.

If you have been exploring the castle for a long time, you will be oppressed by karma. Karma is a dangerous being that undermines vitality and soul. Be careful, but be quick to explore. The deeper you go into the castle, the more memories of the past will come back ...
publisher's summary

Celebrating some of Chewie's best scenes, this is a fast-paced card game where the Wookiee gets all the glory.

Play a card with an angrier Chewie than the last until he eventually loses it! Complete a set of Wookiees, be the first to lose your cards, or be the last one standing to win after three fun filled rounds!

It’s a sweltering day on the fairgrounds! It’s so hot that kids are lined up at Carla Caramel’s ice cream stand. You showed up just in time to help Carla with the line!

Together, help her quickly serve delicious ice cream cones to all the kids.
It’d be a shame if they melt before the kids enjoy them!

By taking turns, each players will help the ice cream vendor satisfy the kids lining up in front of her Stand by rolling a die, which will either let you add a flavor to an ice cream or move the sun one space, or roll a kid, and give an ice cream to one of the children. Once everyone gets an ice cream, you win! But be careful to the sun, which can melt the ice creams.

—description from the publisher

Strange circles have begun to appear in different corn crops... Is the first evidence of extraterrestrial life? Or is it a reinvention of the agricultural business corporation to attract tourists to their decaying farmlands?

In this Roll & Write game, each player rolls two dice and places both numbers in their chosen fields on their crop circles, trying to make the best possible combinations. Every crop circle has 7 fields, and with the numbers inside you can score every Crop Circle in different ways: forming a stair, with different numbers, with the same numbers or with neighbors numbers. At the end of the game you will score with your 8 different crop circles and the different bonus than you can take advantage of. Whoever has the bigger score will win the game.

Can you have the most attractive Crop Circles for the invasion of tourists?

Alice the Train is a light-weight, pick-up and deliver board game that is based on the children's book of the same name. In this game, you play as trains with the mission of picking up animals and dropping them off at the zoo. You will build and manage your train cars based on how many animals each can hold while in the "vores" variant, separating the carnivorous tigers from the herbivores of the game. Collect stars when dropping off animals at the zoo with the winner being the player closest to 15 stars.

—description from the designer

The tower and its monsters stand between your ninja clan's rightful place of rule. You must use every fiber of cunning in this push your luck battle.

Draw seven weapon cards and use them to fight your way to the top. Be careful though, not having the right weapons means a long drop to the foot of the tower.

Weapons are made up of 3 colors (red,blue, and yellow) and 2 types (basic and legendary). The Blue Swords, Red Spears, and Yellow Magic Staffs. The legendary weapons also come with powers.

Each level of the tower has one of 7 different monster types. Discard the matching symbol weapons to advance. Your hand size will continue to shrink as you climb the tower thus making it much harder to have the right weapons.

Other clans are also battling their way to ensure they too are noticed. Play through three rounds of cumulating victory points. The player who is in last in between rounds receives the Mask of Shame - A Legendary Item that makes its holder immune, but at great cost to one's honor.

Will you climb your way into the Halls of Honor or be stained with the Shadows of Shame?

—description from the publisher

A board game using cards from a traditional deck, Ace through 10 in four suits, and a 6X6 square grid, and colored pieces of two colors. Each square on the grid is labeled with a number representing all combination of products of the card ranks, e.g. 1 (1X1),2 (2X1),3, 4 (2X2, 4X1)..81 (9X9). Two players take turns play a card from their hands into either one of two rows, and then place a piece of their color into the location on the board matching the product of the two cards. For instance if a 3 is the top most card exposed and they play a 7 they could put a piece into square 21.  This continues until a player gets four pieces in a row or the other folds.

—user summary

Puffin Rock: Spin & Find game was developed to help children strengthen their memory and practice memory techniques. There are two ways of playing it - an easier and a more advanced mode.

The game has a spinner and tiles with characters. The characters are represented on the tiles multiple times in different environments and poses. The goal of the game is to find and get as many tiles as possible.

In the basic game mode, children first mark the back of the tiles. They can draw their unique markings, shapes and doodles that will help them remember what is on the other side. The tiles are then placed face-down. In the second part of the game they spin the spinner and find the character that the arrow points to among the face-down tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

In the advanced game mode, extra tiles are added, with only some tiles marked, and additional rules apply that make the game even more challenging.

The rules include additional variants for a single player and cooperative gameplay.

—description from the publisher

El Gran Descamisado is a board game that combines strategy, general culture, consensus, chance, attention, verbal dexterity and mental agility. Through seven games that refer to the main milestones in the history of Peronism, an attempt will be made to obtain the seven "Peronist emblems" to become El Gran Descamisado.

To start the game, the players will concentrate their Peronist pawns at the “starting point” and will return there each time their game turn ends. In their corresponding turn, each partner must turn the historical clock. When the needle stops, it will indicate the game to be played, associated with a certain event in the history of Peronism. Each of these games may be individual, in pairs or in a group, as appropriate and will allow to win a Peronist emblem. This dynamic will be repeated until someone meets the ultimate goal of obtaining the 7 emblems.

"Pact of Loyalty": Game of pacts and agreements. Loyalty (and trust) ensures that both parties are favored. If ambition wins, it will become an all-or-nothing challenge.

"Trivia Compañera": Classic question and answer game about curious and historical data of Peronism.

"Choosing a candidate": Voting game where everyone chooses who they think best represents the topic of the slogan that summons them in the electoral act.

"The Renunciation": A game of strategy and chance, where three slogans must be answered blindly, accepting the consequences.

"Peronometer": Fun group game where attention and concentration will allow you to succeed in not stumbling in Peronist calls and gestures.

"La Censura": Classic game where you must guess a censored word from the clues and guidance of your partner, who will also be limited in not mentioning the prohibited words.

"Viva Perón": Verbal skill group game, showing creativity and ingenuity to create linguistic combinations against the clock.


El Gran Descamisado es un juego de mesa que combina estrategia, cultura general, consenso, azar, atención, destreza verbal y agilidad mental. A través de siete juegos que remiten a los principales hitos de la historia del peronismo, se intentará conseguir los siete “emblemas peronistas” para convertirse en EL GRAN DESCAMISADO.â€¨

Para iniciar la partida los/las jugadores/as concentrarán sus peones peronistas en el “punto de inicio” y regresarán allí cada vez que finalice su turno de juego. En su turno correspondiente cada compañero o compañera deberá girar el reloj histórico. Cuando la aguja se detenga, ésta indicará el juego a desarrollar, asociado a determinado suceso de la historia del peronismo. Cada uno de estos juegos podrá ser individual, en duplas o grupal, según corresponda y permitirá ganar un emblema peronista. Se repetirá esta dinámica hasta que alguien cumpla el objetivo final de obtener los 7 emblemas.

Juegos: 
1)  1945: 17 de Octubre “Día de la Lealtad”. Juego: “Pacto de lealtad” Emblema: Escudo PJ
2)  1946: Primera Presidencia. Juego: “Trivia compañera” Emblema: Marcha Peronista
3)  1947: Voto femenino. Ley 13.010. Juego: “Eligiendo candidato/a”. Emblema: Carnet de afiliación
4)  1951: Cabildo Abierto del Justicialismo. Juego: “La Renuncia”. Emblema: Bombo peronista
5)  1952: Segunda Presidencia. Juego: “Peronómetro”. Emblema: Choripan y vino
6)  1955: Golpe de Estado y Proscripción. Juego: “La Censura” Emblema: No me olvides
7)  1973: Tercera Presidencia. Juego: “Viva Perón”. Emblema: Dedos en V

“Pacto de Lealtad”: Juego de pactos y acuerdos. La lealtad (y confianza) asegura que ambas partes salgan favorecidas. Si gana la ambición, se transformará en un desafío a todo o nada.

“Trivia Compañera”: Clásico juego de preguntas y respuestas sobre datos curiosos e históricos del peronismo.

“Eligiendo candidato/a”: Juego de votación donde todos y todas eligen a quien creen que mejor representa el tópico de la consigna que los convoca en el acto eleccionario.

“La Renuncia”: Juego de estrategia y azar, donde deberá responderse a ciegas tres consignas acatando las consecuencias.

“Peronómetro”: Divertido juego grupal donde la atención y concentración permitirá salir airoso/a de no trastabillar en los llamados y ademanes peronistas.

“La Censura”: Clásico juego donde se deberá adivinar una palabra censurada a partir de las pistas y orientaciones de su compañero o compañera, que también se encontrará limitado/a en no mencionar las palabras prohibidas.

“Viva Perón”: Juego grupal de destreza verbal, debiendo demostrar la creatividad e ingenio para crear combinaciones lingüísticas contrarreloj.

Vyapar is a game of trading using the random outcomes of dice and cards. It's a mid-level game for ages +10 and above as involves calculation and strategies to spend less and earn more with multiple trading opportunities to earn. 
The time limit of the game varies from 30 min to 90 min depending on the random outcome.

The synopsis of the game is similar to a stock market scenario where you will buy and sell Commodities of Gold silver and copper 
The game is played on the board where you will land on buy/sell or change rate or power lot multiples by the random outcome of the custom dice and based on the action you will do the activity 
There is a set goal to reach the end by having the minimum required quantity of certain commodities and above so that winner is declared. the fluctuation in the market makes you rich or bankruptcy.

A game-based on card random pick to create a deck (set of Components) to form based on a Quest card or achieve Requirement as defined during the start of the game (combination of 108 water cards(sum)and 2 ingredients of each type)
The winner is the fastest to complete with the least possible deck set of the Ingredients

The game is played between 2-6 players.
It's a mid-level game for ages +8 and above as involves calculation and strategies to make sure you win with lesser cards and fastest to do the calculation and submit the set of cards
The time limit of the game varies from 10 min to 30 min depending on random outcome and level of gameplay.
There are various levels involved in this game to increase the complexity of calculations, increase the difficulty, and also to have killing strategies to make the opponent rebuild his complete deck thereby increasing the chance to win.

The game has 2 variation sets with 8 levels in the game from simple to advanced combination of ingredients

The advantage and limitation is both the calculations as you need to calculate the combination by mind mathematics(this majorly helps the children to do fast calculations of addition and multiplication).

A cooperative rescue operation game to safeguard the little naughty elephant to its family
this game is an extended edition of Operation Khedda and uses the same tiles and few characters to play

as earlier indicated the game is played on the same components of Operation khedda( Terrain Tiles and obstacles are the same) with certain changes to accommodate the fantasy theme of rescuing little Naughty Elephant. Here the player instead of capturing works on a clearing of a path for the elephant to join its heard from starting point to endpoint ( currently 2 sets of rules one with timed/ 24 rounds co-operative game and the other with one player as a ranger to capture and second player as a rescuer)
and win is the same Elephant rescued/captured or lost in the woods ( co-operative strategy).

It is the late 13th century and history is altered by the rise of the Worldbreakers, individuals who harness the mysterious substance mythium to magnify their natural talents. The Mongol princess Khutulun, a Worldbreaker and a descendent of the great Chinggis Khan, is reuniting the distant tribes of the Mongol Empire. However, other factions are rising to oppose her, each with their own agenda.

Worldbreakers: Advent of the Khanate is a customizable two-player card game. Players start the game with a Worldbreaker that has a unique special ability and a deck of 30 cards. Each player aims to be the first to reach 10 power, which is gained by developing Location cards and by attacking the opponent.

The game is divided into rounds, during each of which the players alternate taking turns. A turn is composed of one action, such as gaining mythium (the currency of the game), drawing a card, playing a card, or attacking the opponent. Worldbreakers has three card types: events, followers, and locations. Events are impactful one-time effects. Followers are people who join your cause and can either defend your board or attack your opponent. Finally, Locations are places where mythium can be collected. They have a numbered list of stages, each of which can be developed for a one-time bonus such as power or resources.

Proper timing and resource management is key to victory: wait too long, and your opponent will mount a crushing attack or finish developing their Locations for a power advantage. Who will wrestle control of mythium and forever reshape history?

—description from the designer

King's Color is a chess variant, played on a tri-colored hex-hex board.  Each king is confined to a 3x3 castle surrounded by a wall.  The other pieces are rooks or bishops, which promote to queens.   The big twist to this game is that when the king moves onto a different color, all the rooks become bishops, and all the bishops on the new color become rooks.

Capturing is limited to pieces inside the castle, which influences the game to be oriented around checkmate rather than attrition.

In this quiz game, make up false answers that are more likely than the real one. The more the opposing team bets on it, the more chips it loses, the closer you get to victory!

No more bluffing and more laughs with 440 amazing new cards!

North Africa ‘41 covers the campaign in North Africa from Rommel’s first offensive in late March 1941 through the end of December 1941. During that period Rommel’s forces dashed across Cyrenaica and made it to the Egyptian frontier. However, he was not able to take the critical port of Tobruk defended by the stubborn Australians. With superior tanks, combined arms doctrine, and 88mm Flak guns (used as anti-tank weapons) the Axis forces successfully fought off two counterattacks from the east—the Allied operations called Brevity and Battleaxe. Later in the year, before Rommel could make his planned assault against Tobruk, the Allies launched Operation Crusader and drove the Axis forces back to their original starting positions at El Agheila.

North Africa ’41 allows players to study the campaign and refight it with their own strategies. The game includes a detailed map of the Western Desert and a meticulously researched order of battle.

The game uses the simple Move-Fight-Supply game system developed in Normandy ’44 and Holland ’44. Important elements like supply, troop quality, tank quality, artillery support, and command and control are all reflected in the game.

Game Scale
1 hex = 8 miles
1 game turn = half a month = 2-3 impulses of 3-8 days each
Units: Battalion to Brigade

Components
2 maps -  One 22” x 34” mapsheet and one 22” x 28” mapsheet (total area 22" x 61.75")
2 counter sheets (9/16” counters)
2 setup and reinforcement cards
2 identical CRT/TEC player aid cards
1 rule book
1 play book with extended example of play, design notes, and historical notes

Scenarios
• Enter Rommel: March-June 1941 (7 turns, both maps)
• Campaign Game: March-December 1941 (19 turns, both maps)
• Crusader: November-December 1941 (3 turns, both maps)

Robots is a matching card game that invites you to observe, compare and focus your attention.

Goal of the game:
Be the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. Each player will be able to get rid of their cards every time they find matches in eyes, mouth or nose with the card that is face up on the table.

To play between 2 or more, from the age of 5.

A simple roll and move game with dinosaurs that accompanies the comic book "Kalle Anka & C: O" no. 42, October 18, 1993 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Roll the dice and move your game piece, read what is in the square. First in goal wins.

—user summary

A simple roll and move game with Disney´s Pocahontas as the theme (included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C: O" no. 49, December 4, 1995). Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck. Roll the dice and move your game piece to the finish line.

—user summary

This game consists of a serious of 4 educational games where children learn more about themselves and their friends.

1. Ordering
This is a cooperative ordering game where all cards are put face up on the table. An adult asks the children to find all cards belinging to one category (eg. all cards with something eatable)

2. Sorting
This is a cooperative game where all children try to categorize cards one by one.

3. Taking
All cards are put face up on the table. An adult reads a story. As soon as one of the pieces on the cards is mentioned in the story, the kids should take the corresponding card. The fastest kid with the most cards wins.

4. Remembering
7 cards are put face up on the table. The remaining ones are put in the box. An adult reads a story. As soon as one of the pieces on the cards which are in the box is mentioned in the story, the kid shouts out. If it's correct and the card is in the box, the child gets one of the cards on the table. If it's wrong and the piece is on the table, the child has to put one of his cards back on the table.  
The kid with the best memory and therefore the most cards wins.

A simple game with Disney's squirrels Chip ´n´ Dale where the first in the squirrels nest wins. But you have to get the number in the next square with the dice to move to that square.

The game is included in the comic book "Musse Pigg & C:o", No. 9, September 1983 (Musse Pigg is the swedish name for Mickey Mouse).

This is a short game before going to bed. 
The starting player rolls the dice and moves the sandman accordingly and puts a star on all the fields he passes by. Now it's the next player's turn who rolls the dice again and puts stars on the board. 
When all stars are on the board, the next round begins: The starting player rolls the dice again, but this time he turns all the stars face down. When all stars are face down, the job of the sandman is done and the kids can go to sleep.
The kid, whose stars are the last face up, wins.

—user summary

A game based on the traditional Korean card game Go Stop, with some differences. The game uses a modernized, more colorful Hanafuda deck. Flower Battle differs from Go Stop in the following ways:
1. Although 4 players may begin, only 3 players may play the main game; there is a pre-round elimination procedure in which player who "dies" may sell his/her Gold cards (called Bright cards in Go Stop) for points.
2. Go Stop decks have 4 or 5 joker/wild cards; Flower Battle has 3 wild cards that are doublers and a blank card for you to customize.
3. Flower Battle has options for scoring such as Wild Boar Hunt (players put their scoring sticks in a box; the player with the boar card wins the sticks) and Clear the Ground (if you collect the last 2 cards on the table, you also receive a plain card from each opponent's collection).
4. Point values differ slightly; in Go Stop, collecting all 5 brights typically gives you 15 points. In Flower Battle, you receive 10 points.

The original version comes with a deck of cards and a pouch of color counting sticks for keeping score.

A cat themed card game that is as simple to play like UNO but you can perform fast-paced combos with smooth interactive gameplay.

Each player starts out with 8-10 cards depending on the amount of people playing. The goal is to get rid of your hand as fast as possible but if someone goes out that won't necessarily end the game. Drawing cards is not a punishment. If another player plays a counter active card against the player that went out then that player won't win and that will give someone the opportunity to either stop that player or steal the win from that player.

The unique factor of this game creates simple interaction during any player's turn where the game still flows forward without ever stalling or back tracking which brings an enjoyable experience for everyone.

The possibilities can be endless and unpredictable. Every card was developed to never start out with a bricked hand, which will bring the quality to the game where no one ever feels as if they're at a disadvantage to win.

—description from the publisher

A Malaysian-made card game that incorporates strategy and competitive gameplay. Players accumulate trophy cards by winning battles. This addictive and fun game is guaranteed to light up your day. (description at back of box)

The game consists of trophy cards which are worth point values, and duel cards, which have duel points and are used to compete for the trophy cards. At setup, a number of stacks of trophy cards are laid out to match the number of players. Players are dealt 6 duel cards.

During play, players take turns to play duel cards next to the trophy stacks. Duel cards have different strengths and abilities. Once a third duel card is played next to a trophy stack, that stack is evaluated and the player with the highest duel card strength wins the stack. The stack is then replenished.

Duel cards come in different suits, and each type of trophy stack only accepts specific suits.

The game ends when the trophy deck runs out. For a shorter game, play to a fixed number of points instead.

During 1989, the company Smarties, which makes chocolate candy, released a free board game in Sweden. The game was called the "Smarties game" and was available in stores for free if you bought a package of Smarties. The game also appeared for free in some comic books. Smarties used chocolate candy as game pieces and the winner got to eat all the game pieces. It's a simple roll and move game. First in goal wins. Each player start with 5 Smarties, during the game you can win or lose Smarties. If you down to zero Smarties you out of the game.

Flip a subject card in the pile, then flip a letter card from the other pile. Start the timer at 3 minutes. Everyone writes down words they can think of about the subject and the letter to collect points. The one with the most points after 5 rounds wins. The game was included in the comic magazin "Kalle Anka & C:0", nr. 8, 18 February 1991 (Kalle Anka is the swedish name for Donald Duck).

A simple roll and move game with a Christmas theme that was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 52/53, 21 December 1992 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Each turn roll the die and move. If you end up in a red square with a number, read the instruction for that square and follow it. First in goal wins.

Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers is a scenario-based competitive sci-fi strategy game for 2-4 players where each scenario brings you into one of the many battles going on in a galactic-wide war. During the game you will build a thriving economy to fuel the battle while expanding your area of control with fleets of ships.

Gameplay:
In Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers, you assume the role of one of four unique galactic factions fighting for resources and territory. At the beginning of every turn, you collect resources from fields you control which you can spend on constructing Buildings on Planets, buying Ships, and researching Ship Upgrades to improve them. By moving your Ships into new fields, you expand your reach to get more resources and trigger Events which help you grow even faster. By growing your economy, you’re able to unlock new building tiers to bring the war the next level. Each faction follows their very own goals in the scenarios to gain Influence, and the one with the most influence points at the end wins the battle and one day, possibly the war.

WELCOME TO PLANET MARS!
It's the year 2090. Your spaceship has just landed on Mars. Captain Capability, Captain Courage, Captain Creativity, and Captain Compassion need to be able to train themselves on Mars to collect supplies in order to help them settle. But here's the twist - to help the astronauts survive, you are the Master Mind. Your astronaut needs to collect all the supplies and essentials to survive on Mars and you can use your predictive instincts to do so.

Building on the core game mechanics of Coder Mindz, this game adds set collection and learning about the planet Mara and space exploration to combine both AI and astronomy education. The idea is easy - play a board game, help the astronauts explore Mars, visit various places, collect necessary supplies, and a lot more. All in a fun and exciting Martian Adventure!

Learning Coding and AI concepts help you connect with real coding and AI.

Symposium is a Descended From The Queen storytelling card game for 3-8 players, simulating a philosophical dinner party (or "symposium") in the classical style of the ancient Greek world and based on Plato's work of the same name, with some modifications to make it more accessible to a modern audience.

In the game you play guests at dinner party filled with interesting people: philosophers, poets, doctors, playwrights, and many others. All the best things in life are there: good food, wine, beautiful servants, and interesting conversation. You are a guest, and after you get comfortable your host makes a request of you: make a speech in praise of love. Every guest gives a speech, the contents of which are directed by a different metaphysical perspective. If your speech is the best one, the host will award you the relevant card.

After this initial round of play the role of host shifts, new perspectives are selected, and a new Question card is drawn by a new host; introducing the players to a variety of interesting questions. (What is is to be wise? What is courage? Why do I still love them?) Fresh speeches are given, and the card is awarded. Play continues in this manner until the You are drunk card is selected, at which point the game is over. The guest with the most cards at the end of the game not only wins, but is also the wisest.

Turn-based strategy about running a space agency and exploring the solar system in the new space race. Each player takes on the role of one of the 5 space agencies, and in his turn can perform two of the 9 possible actions, such as developing the agency on the technology tree, launching a rocket, conducting research, placing buildings, or sabotage.

The game board is a model of the Solar System, consisting of 5 movable rings. On each ring there are successive objects of the Solar System, and the rings are divided into such numbers of squares, that rotating each of the rings by 1 square per round, the speed of planets and rockets on their orbits around the Sun is maintained according to Kepler's law!

Once all players have made their move, we rotate each ring and the positions of the planets and rockets change. This means that players, in order to optimize their missions and not waste valuable time, must learn to predict the future position of planets and start planning rocket launches in advance, just like real space agencies.

Development tree is divided into three branches: space tourism, base construction and sabotage. Players have to manage their budget on an ongoing basis, so they don't run out of funds at the crucial moment of the space race. In addition, each of the space agencies: USA, Russia, Europe, China and Japan, has its own unique bonus.

—description from the designer

Os 3 Porquinhos ("The 3 Little Pigs") is the first volume in a series of fun games based on ancient tales passed down from generation to generation, later grouped into books by writers who became famous for such feats and came to be known as "Fairy Tales".
Here players have to band together to stop the wolf from taking down their houses. For that, they must think strategically and together, as it is a cooperative game.
Build the three houses as quickly as possible by putting an end to the wolf's plans will make the players win!

—description from the designer

In Dollars Wanted, you and your fellow crooks work together to crack safes...sort of.

You place crowbars, dynamite, revolvers, and other tools in rows of face-down cards in front of buildings, and if you manage to crack the safe at just the right time, you'll scoot away with a lot of dollars. Grab too early and hesitate too long, however, you'll wind up with nothing for your effort.

It's an abstract game similiar to Round Chess. The game is played in turns on a Circular board with one player playing as red and the other as green. Players move their pieces between spaces according to the rules of the piece being moved. There are seven different pieces. The goal is to be the first player to bring your Cardinal to Vatikan (center of the board) through the opponents half or to remove the opponents Cardinal.

England, 1459. The son of the great Henry V has not lived to fill his father's shoes. England has lost the Hundred Years War, and mighty lords amass lands and wealth rivaling the King’s own. Henry IV left the door open for any such powerful lord with good pedigree to reach for the throne, and the best candidate is Richard Plantagenet, Duke of York.

Mounting tension over the Crown leads to armed clashes, under the excuse of freeing the king from his evil counsellors, and finally ignites the Wars of the Roses that William Shakespeare would immortalize in his plays:

A Yorkist rebellion that succeeds in placing Edward IV on the throne and exiling the Lancastrians to Scotland and France.
A civil war pitting Warwick the Kingmaker and King Edward’s brother Clarence against the King and his other brother Richard Gloucester.
The reinstatement for a few months of Henry VI and the invasion from France by his son and wife leading to a final contest between Richard III and Henry Tudor (later known as Henry VII) and the Battle of Bosworth that ends the Plantagenet dynasty.
Treason, bravery, political maneuver, and a cast of memorable characters mark one of the most intense and divided periods of English history.

In Plantagenet—the newest volume in Volko Ruhnke's Levy & Campaign Series—players lead one of the two factions across the three main periods of war, as individual scenarios or the entire Wars of the Roses.

Designer Francisco Gradaille adds overall and local political influence to Volko’s medieval operation system to reflect the ever-changing loyalties of the time while keeping play familiar to fans of the Series. Players will create and maintain a network of allied lords and nobles in order to obtain the provender and coin needed to supply and pay their armies. As ravaging and looting will damage each side’s reputation, each faction will strive to convince cites to join its side. Great battles will seek to kill or capture enemy lords—perhaps even a king. Two kinds of operational moves will be in play: the military and the political.

In the end, when the dust settles and all arrows have flown, one rose will sit on the throne. White or Red, York or Lancaster, gather your troops and banners and join the fight.

—description from the publisher

Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City is a big box strategy game with miniatures in which gangs fight for control of a city, with the city also being a living part of the game.

1 to 4 players take on the role of ruthless gangs vying for control of the underground in the glittering hellhole that is Night City. Clash with other Gangs in the meat or on the Net, as your enterprising band of toughs seeks to gain dominance over the criminal underworld that rules the streets. Only the boldest will be remembered, and your Street Cred will pave your way to the top.

In Single Player mode, you are pitted against an opposing Gang and an Edgerunner (Johnny or either V's) in a free-for-all for Night City. Similar to the multiplayer mode, the faction with the most Street Cred wins.

In the game, players assume the role of a gang leader, with you organizing your gang members to take power in the city. Your actions affect not only your game and your opponents but the city itself. Each gang has different attributes and goals, giving each player a different gaming experience.

You play as a squirrel and collect as many nuts as you can. Watch out, there are cars to hit you that make you lose your nuts. Plus, you can steal nuts, roll the dice and get more nuts, also skip players. The goal is to get a total of 60 nuts before anybody else.

Two knights challenge each other in a tournament. A bidding system allow to win each turn. Winning two turns in a row means that the opponent is unsaddled: a knight on saddle has bonus on his bets against an unsaddled one. The player winning three turns more than the opponent wins the game.

—description from the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #10.

WISP is the new trick-taking card game that is recognisably different from some established trick-taking games. The core differences include the following aspects:


     You can compete as a team or individually.
     There are no "normal" cards that are hierarchically equal. So you can get into trick-taking incredibly quickly.
     It will always be dealt the same number of cards.
     The announcement of a trick to be taken is an inferior element, which exists only in the team variant.


Welcome to the world of mythical creatures and have fun dueling!

Put all that streaming, scrolling, and sharing to the test with questions about bingeworthy shows, chart-topping hits, major headlines, hilarious memes, and more from 2010 to 2020. Think you’re the GOAT when it comes to 2010s pop culture quiz games? Here's your chance to prove it!

The Trivial Pursuit Decades 2010 to 2020 board game features pop culture trivia questions from 6 categories, including Playlist, Bingeworthy, Culture, News Alert, Break the Internet, and Game On. Gather friends and family members for a fun night of trivia. Leave out the gameboard and play using cards only! The Trivial Pursuit Decades 2010 to 2020 game cards come in a convenient box to take on the go.
